title: Sr. Product Marketing Manager, G HUB
description: Logitech is the Sweet Spot for people who want their actions to have a positive global impact while having the flexibility to do it in their own way. The Team and Role: G HUB is the main software platform serving a massive userbase of Logitech G fans with device configuration, customization and connection to their gaming ecosystem. The role is to develop and manage the go to market strategy for G HUB as a key strategic value of the Logitech G ecosystem. This role requires massive cross discipline coordination, understanding of deep and technical gaming use cases and current events, and experience marketing software and gaming hardware in a modern media and user environment in global markets. You must deeply understand gamers and the ever changing user and market needs. Your Contribution: Be Yourself. Be Open. Stay Hungry and Humble. Collaborate. Challenge. Decide and just Do. Share our passion for Equality and the Environment. These are the behaviors and values you'll need for success at Logitech. In this role you will: Support and collaborate with SW Product Marketing, SW product and hardware teams on continued development and deployment of the G HUB marketing strategy. Collaborate with customer experience, social media, brand, regional and channel marketing, product marketing teams and many more to integrate G HUB and ecosystem messaging into extended go-to-market plans. Communicate and coordinate strategy and logistics across a wide stakeholder list. Maintain and extend G HUB visual identify system and toolkit materials to support new and updated hardware and software roadmap. Manage internal and external agency relationships for asset and strategic development Produce marketing and training related content for internal and external use explaining benefits of products and features. Key Qualifications: For consideration, you must bring the following minimum skills and experiences to our team: Minimum education required - bachelor's degree in marketing, software engineering, science, business or equivalent work experience. 7+ years of product marketing, campaign management and/or product management roles in gaming, software or hardware. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Will often be presenting complex and extensive plans to large groups of stakeholders across multiple cultures. Experience in managing programs/projects involving matrixed global, cross-functional teams Experience managing creative teams and agencies for both strategic and media output. In addition, preferable skills and behaviors include: Extensive gaming knowledge. You game daily, you love games, you care about gaming. Extremely collaborative and positive personality. Critical position in a large and complicated org. Spokesperson experience. On camera talent, writing skills, thought leadership is a huge plus. PC gaming hardware knowledge and experience. Compensation: This position offers an annual base salary typically between $ 145000 and $ 210,000 .In certain circumstances, higher compensation will be considered based on the business need, candidate experience, and skills. Logitech offers benefits such as Medical Coverage, Dental Coverage, Vision Coverage, Traditional and Roth 401(k) Plans, Flexible Spending Accounts, Employee Share Purchase Plan (ESPP), Basic and Additional Life Insurance, Disability Coverage, Adoption and Surrogacy Assistance, Tuition Reimbursement Plans, Commuter Benefits, Paid Time Off, Paid Holidays, Bereavement Leave, and Paid Parental Leave. Logitech also offers Wellness Programs, Health Savings Account Plans, access to Expert Medical Opinions, Identity Theft Protection, Breast Milk Delivery to Nursing Mothers on Business Travel, access to a Group Legal Plan, Donations Matching Programs, Employee Product Discounts, and access to Auto, Home, and Pet Insurance. #LI-SN1 Across Logitech we empower collaboration and foster play. We help teams collaborate/learn from anywhere, without compromising on productivity or continuity so it should be no surprise that most of our jobs are open to work from home from most locations. Our hybrid work model allows some employees to work remotely while others work on-premises. Within this structure, you may have teams or departments split between working remotely and working in-house. Logitech is an amazing place to work because it is full of authentic people who are inclusive by nature as well as by design. Being a global company, we value our diversity and celebrate all our differences. Don't meet every single requirement? Not a problem. If you feel you are the right candidate for the opportunity, we strongly recommend that you apply. We want to meet you! We offer comprehensive and competitive benefits packages and working environments that are designed to be flexible and help you to care for yourself and your loved ones, now and in the future. We believe that good health means more than getting medical care when you need it. Logitech supports a culture that encourages individuals to achieve good physical, financial, emotional, intellectual and social wellbeing so we all can create, achieve and enjoy more and support our families. We can't wait to tell you more about them being that there are too many to list here and they vary based on location. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability. If you require an accommodation to complete any part of the application process, are limited in the ability, are unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us toll free at +1-510-713-4866 for assistance and we will get back to you as soon as possible.

Join TikTok Search, you'll help shape the future of visual and social-first search experiences and push the boundaries of discovery in the world of video. We are looking for talented individuals to join our team in 2026. As a graduate, you will get opportunities to pursue bold ideas, tackle complex challenges, and unlock limitless growth. Launch your career where inspiration is infinite at TikTok. Successful candidates must be able to commit to an onboarding date by end of year 2026. Please state your availability and graduation date clearly in your resume. Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is applicable to TikTok and its affiliates' jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. We encourage you to apply as early as possible. Responsibilities: Responsible for improving TikTok search user experience through research for different product functions, content, and algorithm strategies. Provide actionable insights to cross-functional teams on the product's future iterations based on experience evaluation, data analysis, market research, and user research. Collaborate with the international operations team to facilitate the implementation of the research and evaluation plans, especially ensure the efficiency and accuracy of the deliverables. Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree or above. Possess keen insight into user experience and strong data analysis skills, with the ability to identify product issues based on various information under guidance and drive problem-solving. Clear logic, strong communication skills, and a spirit of teamwork. Preferred Qualifications: Project experience in search, recommendation, NLP, or AI-related fields. By submitting an application for this role, you accept and agree to our global applicant privacy policy, which may be accessed here: https://careers.tiktok.com/legal/privacy Job Information For Pay TransparencyCompensation Description (Annually) The base salary range for this position in the selected city is $122360 - $246400 annually.  Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate's qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units.  Benefits may vary depending on the nature of employment and the country work location. Employees have day one access to medical, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) savings plan with company match, paid parental leave, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, wellbeing benefits, among others. Employees also receive 10 paid holidays per year, 10 paid sick days per year and 17 days of Paid Personal Time (prorated upon hire with increasing accruals by tenure).  The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.  For Los Angeles County (unincorporated) Candidates:  Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state, and local laws including the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act. Interacting and occasionally having unsupervised contact with internal/external clients and/or colleagues;  2. Appropriately handling and managing confidential information including proprietary and trade secret information and access to information technology systems; and  3. Exercising sound judgment.  About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.  Why Join Us Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect - and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.  We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us. title: Technical Product Manager, Telephony Infrastructure
description: About Us Hippocratic AI has developed a safety-focused Large Language Model (LLM) for healthcare. The company believes that a safe LLM can dramatically improve healthcare accessibility and health outcomes in the world by bringing deep healthcare expertise to every human. No other technology has the potential to have this level of global impact on health. Why Join Our Team Innovative Mission: We are developing a safe, healthcare-focused large language model (LLM) designed to revolutionize health outcomes on a global scale. Visionary Leadership: Hippocratic AI was co-founded by CEO Munjal Shah, alongside a group of physicians, hospital administrators, healthcare professionals, and artificial intelligence researchers from leading institutions, including El Camino Health, Johns Hopkins, Stanford, Microsoft, Google, and NVIDIA. Strategic Investors: We have raised a total of $278 million in funding, backed by top investors such as Andreessen Horowitz, General Catalyst, Kleiner Perkins, NVIDIA's NVentures, Premji Invest, SV Angel, and six health systems. World-Class Team: Our team is composed of leading experts in healthcare and artificial intelligence, ensuring our technology is safe, effective, and capable of delivering meaningful improvements to healthcare delivery and outcomes. For more information, visit www.HippocraticAI.com. We value in-person teamwork and believe the best ideas happen together. Our team is expected to be in the office five days a week in Palo Alto, CA unless explicitly noted otherwise in the job description. Overview We are hiring a TPM to manage Hippocratic AI's global telephony infrastructure, ensuring our AI agents can reliably reach patients, providers, and healthcare systems across a wide variety of geographies. This is a cross-functional role requiring infrastructure-level technical savvy and regulatory awareness. Responsibilities Lead roadmap and delivery for global outbound telephony systems. Maintain reliability, reputation, and deliverability of our call infrastructure. Integrate and manage vendors (e.g., Twilio, Telnyx, Five9) and monitor performance. Build internal tools for campaign tracking, call QA, and global reporting. Ensure compliance with US and international telephony regulations and reputation frameworks. Qualifications 4+ years in technical product or engineering management, preferably in telephony or communications platforms. Hands-on experience with global telephony providers (e.g., Twilio, Talkdesk, Incontact, Five9, Avaya). Understanding of STIR/SHAKEN, call reputation management, number pooling, and deliverability. Experience managing vendors and ensuring scalable quality. ***Be aware of recruitment scams impersonating Hippocratic AI. All recruiting communication will come from @ hippocraticai.com email addresses. We will never request payment or sensitive personal information during the hiring process. If anything

title: Manager, Brand Management & Product Marketing
description: Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of. Who We Are… When we say, "the stuff dreams are made of," we're not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD's vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what's next… From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive. WB Games is a leader in the games industry across all game platforms and mobile devices. Our diverse and inclusive workforce creates and brings to life the most beloved characters, franchises, heroes, and wizards in the world. We are fans of what we make and proud of what we do. We have studios and offices across the globe. The Job The Manager, Brand Management & Product Marketing , will oversee the development, management and execution of the global marketing strategies for assigned PC/console titles within the Harry Potter universe, acting as a key integrator across teams to ensure alignment, consistency, and excellence across all marketing touch-points. You'll tap into the spirit and storytelling richness of the Wizarding World with an instinct for what excites its global fanbase, helping translate franchise magic into compelling creative and marketing moments that resonate broadly. This role contributes to go-to-market planning, assists in shaping product marketing strategy, helps define global positioning, supports the development of worldwide creative materials, manages cross-functional and partner relationships, and executes global marketing plans that deepen engagement with the Harry Potter community. The Daily Support development and execution of global multi-year marketing plans for PC and console Harry Potter titles. Contribute to campaign briefs, franchise strategy inputs, and long-range planning under senior guidance. Establish global positioning and creative strategy and ensure alignment with key stakeholders and development studios. Gather market, audience, and competitive insights to inform creative direction. Partner cross-functionally to ensure product development, consumer marketing, digital marketing, PR, research, trade and sales execution is aligned with strategic and financial goals. Track and socialize product, competitive, and player insights. Manage workflows and ensure deliverables meet campaign timelines and strategic goals. Manage campaign budgeting and billing for assigned titles. Maintain budget trackers, process POs, support forecasting, and ensure vendor compliance. Manage relationships with key external partners such as agencies, first party, and promotional partners. Manage day-to-day deliverables, asset trafficking, timelines, and approvals. Liaise with internal teams across the broader organization and other key partners to develop and execute on cross-promotional programs. Collaborate with consumer products, Harry Potter franchise teams, partnerships, and regional marketing teams on campaign beats. Ensure programs support global strategy and reinforce brand pillars. The Essentials Demonstrated experience in brand marketing, project management, and campaign execution. Minimum 5+ years experience in marketing roles within the gaming industry Highly organized with a strong attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects in within a large organization Strong analytical, verbal, and written communication skills, with the ability to translate insights into actionable recommendations. Proven ability to work collaboratively across cross-functional teams, studios, external partners, regional teams, and licensors/licensees. Excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skills, with comfort managing partner and vendor communications. Self-motivated, results-oriented, and adaptable, with the ability to thrive in shifting or ambiguous situations. Project Management and coordination across functional groups, studios, and external partners/licensors Bachelor's degree or equivalent, preferably in communications or marketing. Ability to travel as needed. How We Get Things Done… This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview. Championing Inclusion at WBD Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects a wide array of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law. If you're a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our accessibility page for instructions to submit your request. In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to external market data, internal equity, location, skill set, experience, and/or performance. Base pay is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery's total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $35,360 - $6,175.00 salary per year. title: Product Management Tech
description: Description: Type: Non-exempt (Part-time, not benefit eligible) Department: Hospital Services Work Days/Hours: Tuesday- Thursday; 8:30 am - 5:00 pm Reports to: Product Management Manager Location: Jenny Eller Donor Center, Fresno, CA Pay Range: $19.00-$21.13/hourly Pay Grade: 5 Work Modality: On-site Job Summary This position is focused on providing efficient and courteous service to our hospital partners across the Central California Blood Center service area through the management of requested blood products and services. This role places strong emphasis on providing exceptional customer service to all external and internal clients, through in-person interactions, phone, or web-based systems, by providing and/or creating access to blood products and/or services needed by hospital partners. Essential Responsibilities Ensures proper labeling of blood products, packing and fulfillment of orders for delivery, regionally and/or nationally, while also assisting in managing inventory resources. Handle incoming customer calls efficiently with excellent phone etiquette and professionalism. Receive orders, pack, and ship blood products according to established policies and SOPs. Direct hospital complaints or questions to relevant departments promptly. Escalate significant issues to management for resolution. Cultivate positive hospital relationships. Maintain accurate records and document processes effectively. Identify potential hospital service issues and implement proactive intervention measures. Manage blood inventory efficiently, including importing blood products from other facilities. Perform all assigned duties in compliance with internal SOPs and external regulations, including blood handling process. Monitor and maintain Hospital Services equipment, updating records and charts as necessary. Perform data quality control checks on storage equipment and shipping procedures. Performs component preparation, including labeling and irradiation of blood products, quality control and current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMPs). Performs packing of all blood and/or other products for shipping and delivery. Perform special procedures such as washing of units and adding satellite bags for pediatric transfusion. As needed, safely and courteously transport and deliver blood products, specimens, equipment and supplies to hospital partners and CCBC sites across the Central California Blood Center service area. Attend all 1:1 and department meetings as scheduled. Demonstrates alignment with and adherence to the company's core values in all interactions, decisions, and work activities; serves as a role model for fostering a positive, respectful, and ethical workplace culture This position requires consistent, on-time attendance in accordance with company policy. Excessive tardiness or absenteeism may impact performance and employment status. Employees in this role are entitled and expected to take compliant meal and rest periods in accordance with California law. Note: The duties and responsibilities described above are not a comprehensive list and additional tasks may be assigned to the employee from time to time; or the scope of the job may change as necessitated by business demands. Requirements: Qualifications and Skills Education/Licenses/Experience High school diploma or GED, required One year in clerical support role requiring strong attention to detail Previous experience in customer service or a related field, preferred Must have a valid California driver's license, and a clean driving history with no major violations in the last five years Skills Must demonstrate courteous and professional phone and written communication skills. Excellent ability in providing professional, efficient, and friendly service. Must be self-motivated and a team player. Ability to coordinate with other departments on client-related matters. Strong interpersonal and recordkeeping skills. Willingness to accept additional hours where necessary to meet operational needs. Prior computer skills using Microsoft Office (primarily MS Word and Outlook). Physical Requirements Infrequent Driving Frequent lifting/carrying between 0-10 lbs. Frequent lifting/carrying between 11-25 lbs. Frequent sitting Frequent standing Frequent walking Frequent computer use Occasional bending (neck) Occasional bending (waist) Occasional twisting (neck) Occasional pushing and pulling Occasional power grasping Occasional handling Infrequent lifting of 50+ lbs. Infrequent kneeling Infrequent climbing Infrequent squatting Infrequent twisting (waist) Infrequent reaching (above shoulder) Infrequent reaching (below shoulder) Infrequent fine fingering (pinching, picking) Working Conditions Constant working in close proximity to others Frequent exposure to extreme temperature (heat) Occasional exposure to extreme cold temperatures, and could be required to enter walk-in freezer at 32°F or lower Occasional exposure to dust, gas, fumes, or chemicals Infrequent operating of hazardous machinery Infrequent exposure to excessive noise Must wear Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) such as gloves, mask or goggles Possible exposure to bloodborne pathogens The Central California Blood Center is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, hair style, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Consistent with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and state of California Civil Rights Law, it is the policy of Central California Blood Center to provide reasonable accommodation when requested by a qualified applicant or employee with a disability, unless such accommodation would cause an undue hardship. The policy regarding requests for reasonable accommodation applies to all aspects of employment, including the application process. If reasonable accommodation is needed, please contact the Human Resources Department at myhr@donateblood.org.
company_description: The Central California Blood Center provides blood and services to patients who receive care at 30 hospitals and their network of facilities in Fresno, Tulare, Madera, Kings and Mariposa Counties.
parsed_skills: Communication, communication

title: Senior Product Manager, Tech R&D
description: This role is part of an innovation group that builds new products and improves member experiences across insurance, membership, financial services, roadside support, and travel. The team includes engineers, designers, researchers, and product managers who work together to deliver practical, high-impact solutions that move the organization forward. The Sr. Product Manager for Technology R&D will lead a small team of engineers, developers, and analysts to drive the discovery, testing and assessment of advanced technologies. The role is responsible for identifying and advancing key technological innovations with the potential to transform the future of our clients operations, products, and services. The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background, knowledge of emerging technologies, and experience leading R&D initiatives. What You Will Do: Lead exploration of new technologies and capabilities that can drive future member value and operational efficiencies. Develop and execute a robust R&D roadmap that includes technology assessments, feasibility studies, prototyping, and pilot initiatives. Define and track KPIs to measure effectiveness and impact of R&D projects. Identify and evaluate technology vendors, startups that may support or broaden company's capabilities. Stay informed on the latest industry and technology trends. Manage a team of individual contributors and develop their growth and skill sets. What You Will Need: Four-year college degree in computer science, engineering, data science or equivalent combination of education and work experience required. 7+ years of experience in technology research, development, or innovation. Deep understanding of key technology areas such as AI/ML, IoT, autonomous systems, blockchain or data science. Proven record of accomplishment of driving successful R&D and innovation initiatives. Strong understanding of product development process and methodologies. Effective communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to influence and inspire cross functional teams. Requires a high degree of independent decision making and problem-solving skills. Advanced ability to compile, analyze and interpret statistical data preferred. Advanced ability to think strategically and transform strategy into actionable plans required. Knowledge in Insurtech, Fintech, Travel, Mobility, or other tech related industries. The starting pay range for this position is: $156,500.00 - $208,100.00 Additionally, for full time positions, you will be eligible to participate in our incentive program based upon the achievement of organization, team and personal performance. Benefits: Health coverage for medical, dental, vision 401(K) saving plan with company match AND Pension Tuition assistance PTO for community volunteer programs Wellness program Employee discounts
company_description: We deliver customized solutions that support all your energy, power, battery, charging, infrastructure and telecommunication needs.

title: Product Manager, Data Platform
description: About the Team The OpenAI Platform team builds the foundation that enables every developer, enterprise, and partner to harness OpenAI's models safely, reliably, and at scale. We design and operate the systems that power model serving, API access, billing, developer tooling, and enterprise integrations-forming the connective tissue between OpenAI's research breakthroughs and real-world products. Our mission is to make it effortless for anyone to build with OpenAI technology. We're responsible for the infrastructure and product layers that allow millions of developers to integrate GPT models, fine-tune behavior, manage data, and deliver transformative experiences to their users. We collaborate across product, research, and engineering teams to ensure that innovation in model capabilities translates directly into value for customers. The Platform team spans multiple disciplines, including product management, infrastructure engineering, developer experience, and data systems. We care deeply about reliability, scalability, and simplicity-creating tools that let developers focus on their ideas while we handle the complexity of running world-class AI systems. About the Role Building highly capable agents requires accurate and comprehensive data. We want to build the data platform and integrations to enable enterprises and developers to automate processes through reliable agents. We have the conviction that a new shape of data tooling needs to be invented to achieve this. This role is perfect for someone who has deep experience building new data platforms and integrations that meet the needs of the most sophisticated enterprises. The ideal candidate will evidence a mix of deep understanding of the enterprise data stack, a strong business sense, and the technical depth and curiosity to collaborate with our research and engineering teams. This role is based in San Francisco, CA. We use a hybrid work model of 3 days in the office per week and offer relocation assistance to new employees. In this role, you will: Shape and build the key components of our nascent data platform to enable enterprises and developers to build agents. Be responsible for designing and delivering key data tools and products that meet the security, accuracy and flexibility needs of some of the world's most sophisticated businesses. You might thrive in this role if you: Have experience building data platforms and integrations that meet the needs of enterprises and developers Are technically deep and curious about the data stack and About OpenAI OpenAI is an AI research and deployment company dedicated to ensuring that general-purpose artificial intelligence benefits all of humanity. We push the boundaries of the capabilities of AI systems and seek to safely deploy them to the world through our products. AI is an extremely powerful tool that must be created with safety and human needs at its core, and to achieve our mission, we must encompass and value the many different perspectives, voices, and experiences that form the full spectrum of humanity. We are an equal opportunity employer, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. For additional information, please see OpenAI's Affirmative Action and Equal Employment Opportunity Policy Statement . title: Product Manager, Digital Platforms
description: Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 114,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries. Working at Abbott At Abbott, you can do work that matters, grow, and learn, care for yourself and your family, be your true self, and live a full life. You'll also have access to: Career development with an international company where you can grow the career you dream of. Employees can qualify for free medical coverage in our Health Investment Plan (HIP) PPO medical plan in the next calendar year. An excellent retirement savings plan with a high employer contribution. Tuition reimbursement, the Freedom 2 Save student debt program, and FreeU education benefit - an affordable and convenient path to getting a bachelor's degree. A company recognized as a great place to work in dozens of countries worldwide and named one of the most admired companies in the world by Fortune. A company that is recognized as one of the best big companies to work for as well as the best place to work for diversity, working mothers, female executives, and scientists. The Opportunity This position works out of our Alameda, CA or Milpitas, CA location in the Diabetes Care division where we are focused on helping people with diabetes manage their health with life-changing products that provide accurate data to drive better-informed decisions. We're revolutionizing the way people monitor their glucose levels with our new sensing technology. As a Product Manager, you will create strategic identity-related features and hold responsibility over their business requirements, prioritization, and roadmap. Your strategic thinking and ability to translate complex systems and human needs into impactful digital solutions will shape the future of digital health. You will collaborate across teams to deliver innovative, human-centered experiences that serve our core audiences. This position works out of our Alameda, CA or Milpitas, CA locations. What You'll Work On Lead the product vision, strategy, and roadmap for managing access to Abbott Diabetes Care's digital mobile and web products. Clearly articulate strategic decisions, aligning customer needs with business goals. Identify, define, and prioritize opportunities for innovation and scalability within our product portfolio. Craft compelling narratives to influence key stakeholders. Champion a global, customer-centric design approach, ensuring that user needs drive all product development efforts. Collaborate closely with PMs, Designers, Engineers, and Marketers to de-risk early concepts and activate strategy into scalable solutions. Synthesize user needs and research insights into clear product strategies and features. Establish and evolve feedback loops to continuously improve product quality and user satisfaction. Stay ahead of trends in product management and data-powered experiences, bringing fresh thinking to every project. Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree required 4-6 years of professional experience, including 3+ years of product management experience Experience in identity management or personalization technologies Experience in regulated industries (healthcare, finance, etc.) or global privacy frameworks (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) Preferred Qualifications MBA or advanced degree preferred Proven track record of delivering outstanding consumer product experiences for mobile and web through data-driven, human-centered strategies. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to create clarity in complex challenges Experience building and applying de-risking methodologies in a fast-paced environment. Ability to guide stakeholders in making complex design and business trade-off decisions. Strong customer-centered design approach, using research and data to drive iteration. Exceptional presentation and communication skills, with the ability to connect insights to best practice-based strategies. Skilled in designing product data strategies, translating insights into persuasive narratives and visual aids. Passion for technology, privacy, and strategy, with a commitment to continuous learning. Apply Now Learn more about our health and wellness benefits, which provide the security to help you and your family live full lives: https://abbottbenefits.com/ Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that can help you build your future and live your best life. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity. Connect with us at abbott.com, on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/company/abbott-/, and on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/AbbottCareers. The base pay for this position is $112,000.00 – $224,000.00. In specific locations, the pay range may vary from the range posted.

title: Senior Product Manager - Retail Cloud
description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Product Job Details About Salesforce Salesforce is the #1 AI CRM, where humans with agents drive customer success together. Here, ambition meets action. Tech meets trust. And innovation isn't a buzzword — it's a way of life. The world of work as we know it is changing and we're looking for Trailblazers who are passionate about bettering business and the world through AI, driving innovation, and keeping Salesforce's core values at the heart of it all. Ready to level-up your career at the company leading workforce transformation in the agentic era? You're in the right place! Agentforce is the future of AI, and you are the future of Salesforce. Salesforce's Commerce Cloud is a market leader in its category, as recognized by Gartner and other analysts. Commerce is one of the most exciting product areas at Salesforce; the evolution of unified commerce and the physical retail experience is a fast-evolving category with a dynamic competitive landscape. We are well-positioned to win in the market, with amazing assets in our portfolio (including B2C Commerce, B2B Commerce, OMS, Headless, Payments, and Retail Cloud POS), a diverse and recognizable customer base of world-class companies, and unwavering executive focus. The Commerce Cloud PM will join our team working with Engineering, UX, and GTM teams to deliver our vision of Connected and Unified Commerce in the physical store. You will work with research teams and customers to understand the best modern POS product we can deliver, help to define the roadmap, author user stories with clearly defined goals and acceptance criteria, and work directly with scrum teams to deliver on that vision. Key focus areas: Own product vision for key areas of Retail Cloud POS solution, focusing on omni-channel experiences and personalization features on the POS device Translate retailer needs (store associates, regional managers, IT teams) into roadmap, backlog, and requirements enabling seamless cross-channel transactions Design and champion Agentic capabilities within POS that proactively suggest next best actions for associates and automated task prioritization based on store events Partner cross-functionally with UX for world-class design artifacts, Engineering for delivery and platform stability, and Commerce Cloud product managers for unified commerce experience leveraging shared AI models Core skills needed: Retail Technology Expertise: Experienced with in-store operations, POS systems, and physical commerce technology, with deep knowledge of unified commerce concepts including inventory visibility, order fulfillment, and clienteling at store level Product Management Experience: 7+ years total experience with 4+ years in product management, delivering successful products to millions of users with direct POS market and retail commerce technology experience, including hands-on customer work (especially large enterprise retailers) to understand needs and balance competing demands Leadership & Vision: Able to inspire diverse teams while leading through ambiguity in fast-paced environments; pragmatic visionary who bridges big retail ideas with detailed execution of transaction flows and hardware integrations AI-Driven Innovation: Passionate about leveraging AI to create intelligent, proactive retail workflows and delivering high-quality user experiences for store associates and front-line employees Strategic Execution & Communication: Skilled at navigating multiple priorities, making strategic tradeoffs, and delivering maximum customer value in complex retail technology environments, with strong agile product development skills including authoring clear epics/user stories and outstanding communication skills as the face of the product to diverse internal and external stakeholders Nice to have skills: POS System Integration Experience: Defining product features for distributed order management, real-time inventory APIs, CRM/Clienteling capabilities, and retail hardware integrations (payment terminals, printers, scanners) within POS systems AI-Powered Retail Innovation: Defining and launching in-store/POS features that incorporate Generative AI or Machine Learning to provide proactive, goal-driven suggestions and automated actions for store associates Enterprise B2B Platform Expertise: Experience with Enterprise B2B software and CRM platforms, especially Salesforce, to deliver integrated commerce solutions Unleash Your Potential When you join Salesforce, you'll be limitless in all areas of your life. Our benefits and resources support you to find balance and be your best , and our AI agents accelerate your impact so you can do your best . Together, we'll bring the power of Agentforce to organizations of all sizes and deliver amazing experiences that customers love. Apply today to not only shape the future — but to redefine what's possible — for yourself, for AI, and the world. Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form . Posting Statement Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that's inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education. In the United States, compensation offered will be determined by factors such as location, job level, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Certain roles may be eligible for incentive compensation, equity, and benefits. Salesforce offers a variety of benefits to help you live well including: time off programs, medical, dental, vision, mental health support, paid parental leave, life and disability insurance, 401(k), and an employee stock purchasing program. More details about company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.salesforcebenefits.com.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. For Washington-based roles, the base salary hiring range for this position is $184,000 to $253,000. For California-based roles, the base salary hiring range for this position is $200,800 to $276,100.

title: Senior Product Manager
description: The Company PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy. We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers. We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade. Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities. Job Description Summary: This job focuses on leveraging data to derive insights that align with the product's shared vision and customer needs. It involves gathering customer experience insights to inform product requirements and analyzing research, market data, and usability studies for data-driven decision-making. Responsibilities include monitoring product profitability and budget, leading sprint planning, daily standups, and retrospectives to ensure effective execution, and collaborating with content developers, data scientists, product designers, and user experience researchers to uncover new opportunities. This job is an individual contributor. Job Description: Essential Responsibilities: Uses data to build insights on product or platform requirements consistent with the shared vision for the product. Gathers insights from the customer experience and customer needs to input to product requirements Analyzes research, market analysis and usability studies, research and market analysis to support data-driven decision making Monitors product profitability measures, including budget. Lead sprint planning, daily standups and retrospectives to drive execution. Interfaces with product and technology leadership as needed. Partners with content developers, data scientists, product designers and user experience researchers to identify new opportunities. Expected Qualifications: 3+ years relevant experience and a Bachelor's degree OR Any equivalent combination of education and experience. PayPal is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. Actual Compensation is based on various factors including but not limited to work location, and relevant skills and experience. The total compensation for this practice may include an annual performance bonus (or other incentive compensation, as applicable), equity, and medical, dental, vision, and other benefits. For more information, visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com. The U.S. national annual pay range for this role is $123,500 to $212,850 PayPal does not charge candidates any fees for courses, applications, resume reviews, interviews, background checks, or onboarding. Any such request is a red flag and likely part of a scam. To learn more about how to identify and avoid recruitment fraud please visit https://careers.pypl.com/contact-us. For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations. Our Benefits: At PayPal, we're committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can't do this without our most important asset-you. That's why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you. We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com Who We Are: To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com. Belonging at PayPal: Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal. Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community. We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don't hesitate to apply.

title: Lead Product Manager, AI for Data
description: About the Role Are you passionate about the intersection of data and AI? Does working on large-scale data intelligence systems excite you? Are you thrilled by the opportunity to unlock the full potential of Uber's vast amount of data through AI to accelerate business growth and innovation? If yes, read on! Uber operates one of the most complex and data-rich marketplaces in the world. Every trip, delivery, and order generates vast amounts of data across riders, eaters, drivers, couriers, and merchants. This data fuels Uber's ability to move the world efficiently - from optimizing demand and routing, to understanding real-world behaviors and improving operational excellence. As Uber continues to scale its use of AI, the AI for Data initiative is reimagining how data becomes actionable intelligence - enabling faster insights, smarter decisions, and greater innovation across the company. To accelerate this vision, we're looking for an experienced and visionary Product Manager to define and drive the product strategy for this emerging domain. You'll lead the effort to bring cutting-edge AI capabilities into Uber's data ecosystem, empowering every team to uncover insights faster and make more informed, data-driven decisions. What the Candidate Will Do Define the vision and strategy for AI for Data - setting a bold direction for how AI can transform Uber's data into intelligence that accelerates innovation and operational excellence. Collaborate deeply with data scientists, engineers, analysts, and business leaders to identify and prioritize opportunities where AI can automate and elevate data understanding. Build and execute the roadmap for AI-driven data capabilities - from intelligent data discovery, automated insight generation, knowledge extraction, to conversational analytics and data agents. Partner cross-functionally with engineering, TPM, and UX to deliver scalable, high-impact products that leverage AI and ML across Uber's data platform. Establish clear success metrics and continuously measure adoption, impact, and quality to refine capabilities based on real-world results. Champion the vision across Uber - communicating the roadmap, outcomes, and business impact of AI for Data to executive leadership and cross-functional partners. Basic Qualifications 7+ years of technical Product Management experience delivering successful data, AI, or ML products. Bachelor's or advanced degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related technical field. Deep understanding of modern data platforms, analytics workflows, and AI/ML fundamentals. Strong technical acumen - comfortable engaging with engineers and scientists on system architecture, feasibility, and technical tradeoffs. Excellent understanding of data management, data governance, and emerging trends in AI for data intelligence. Exceptional communication and storytelling skills - able to inspire, align, and motivate diverse teams. Preferred Qualifications Experience building large-scale data intelligence systems or AI/data infrastructure products. Hands-on familiarity with enterprise data and AI platforms such as Databricks, Snowflake, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI. Proven track record of defining and launching platform capabilities that empower developers, analysts, and data scientists. Proven ability to lead through influence, thrive in cross-functional environments, and drive alignment across complex organizations. Passion for Uber's mission and a strong desire to build systems that drive global impact. For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$216,000 per year - USD$240,000 per year. For Sunnyvale, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$216,000 per year - USD$240,000 per year. For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

title: Senior Financial Systems Manager, Workday
description: Employee Applicant Privacy Notice Who we are: Shape a brighter financial future with us. Together with our members, we're changing the way people think about and interact with personal finance. We're a next-generation financial services company and national bank using innovative, mobile-first technology to help our millions of members reach their goals. The industry is going through an unprecedented transformation, and we're at the forefront. We're proud to come to work every day knowing that what we do has a direct impact on people's lives, with our core values guiding us every step of the way. Join us to invest in yourself, your career, and the financial world. Up your game by leveraging your existing extensive Workday Financials knowledge in helping SoFi to continue to revolutionize the financial services industry. This position will both provide traditional Finance support and help implement the integrations between our core internally developed customer facing financial services, third party platforms and Workday Financials. What You'll Do: Support SoFi's use of the Workday Financials solution in addressing Finance business requirements. Work with business leaders and end users to define business requirements and develop associated technical solutions leveraging industry best practices and Workday standard functionality Write requirements & specifications for interfaces to SoFi's internally developed applications Research and recommend Workday plug-ins to extend functionality Document, implement and QA Workday configuration changes associated with both project and daily support Define and program manage the implementation of business process changes required to support SoFi's explosive growth Analyze business information requirements and address through the development of dashboards, reports and a data warehouse solution Perform daily administrative and production support tasks as required Develop and deliver training on SoFi's financial business processes and use of Workday Partner with Corporate Finance on integration with finance planning tools/systems What You'll Need: 8+ years supporting financial business processes 5+ years Workday Financials ERP experience including writing custom reports, building transaction searches, editing scripts and designing workflows Strong, hands-on Workday knowledge required Certifications in Workday (through a Workday certified partner): Accounting Center Cert (Required) Advanced Composite Reporting Prism Reporting Cert Experience with the following required: Multiple subsidiary structure and working with different functional currencies Consolidations SOX compliance Workday Accounting Center Experience Mandatory (deployment experience a strong plus) Data Modeling: FDM design, deployment, and maintenance Experience Leading Workstreams in OTC, PTP, RTR Capturing business requirements, drafting functional design, process design (including scenario design, process flow mapping), prototyping, testing, and training Advanced knowledge of supporting deployments with International Localization in Latin America, Europe, and Asia. Expert level experience designing and implementing the Workday Foundational Data Model for Accounting/Finance Strong verbal and written communication skills Experience managing a product Backlog for Finance and Accounting Experience with Jira / Confluence or other Scrum Management tools B.S. degree in a technical, business or analytical field required Experience with integration platforms such as Boomi, Fivetran or Celigo desired Financial institution experience Familiarity with finance planning tools (ex: IBM Planning Analytics (TM1)), with an understanding/vision of how to architect the perfect solution Experience integrating to any of these 3rd party tools is a plus: Workday HCM, Concur, IBM Planning Analytics, Coupa, Visual Lease, FloQast, Ivalua, ADP Experience with Tableau, Alteryx and SQL (Snowflake) a strong plus Compensation and Benefits The base pay range for this role is listed below. title: Head of Product @ AI Data Labeling Startup
description: Role: Head of Product Location: San Francisco / Bay Area (preferred) Salary: $240k – $300k (Final compensation will depend on experience, skill level, and location.) About our client: Our client is a high-growth AI company building the infrastructure that enables humans and AI to collaborate at scale. They believe that for better AI, better data is needed — and that the best data comes from experts who are well supported, incentivized, and scaffolded for success. Originally founded to empower meaningfully engaged work for experts, our client now orchestrates teams of specialists to help AI models perform expert-only capabilities at scale. They design systems that allow top-tier experts to contribute high-quality data — and AI researchers to consume it seamlessly — enabling their partners to build more capable, reliable, and aligned AI systems. Position Overview: Our client is building the infrastructure layer for expert-curated, extremely high-quality data powering the world's leading AI models. They're seeking a Head of Product to lead product strategy, UX, and design for the platform that connects world-class experts to frontier AI research. This role is ideal for a systems-oriented product leader — someone who has scaled products from ~$1M to $100M+ ARR, blends strong product taste with deep user empathy, and can operate fluently across AI research, expert contributor workflows, and enterprise needs. You will own their expert-facing and customer-facing product surfaces — defining how experts onboard, vet, contribute, and maintain quality, as well as how researchers and enterprise customers interact with their data-delivery systems. Key Responsibilities: Product & Design Leadership Define and drive the end-to-end product vision, UX, and design for their expert and customer platforms. Lead a multidisciplinary team across product management, UX/UI design, and product operations. Establish a product culture grounded in user empathy, experimentation, and high taste. Own prioritization frameworks, roadmap planning, and execution cadence across product verticals. UX, Interface & Expert Experience Design world-class onboarding, vetting, and work interfaces for a global network of experts. Build systems that ensure expert motivation, fraud detection, and sustained high-quality contributions. Partner with Delivery to translate operational workflows into intuitive and elegant product surfaces. Champion accessibility, usability, and delight in every user interaction. AI-Native Product Development Partner with Research & Applied AI to integrate ML-powered capabilities across expert and customer interfaces. Translate emerging AI capabilities into usable product experiences that meaningfully improve throughput and quality. Define human-in-the-loop UX for expert review, annotation, and feedback cycles. Business & Strategic Leadership Serve as a key thought partner to the CEO and executive team on product-driven business strategy. Collaborate with GTM, Operations, and Customer Success to align product development with revenue, adoption, and customer needs. Represent the product and design vision in board, investor, and strategic partner settings. Develop metrics and frameworks that tie product outcomes directly to business impact. Qualifications: Strategic & Entrepreneurial Leadership Founder-like ownership with experience scaling 0 1 and 1 100 products. Operates fluidly from long-term vision to pixel-level detail. Thinks in systems, leverage, and outcomes — not just features. Design Taste & User Obsession Deep aesthetic sensibility and product craftsmanship. Relentless focus on user empathy and behavior — especially experts and researchers. Balances simplicity, beauty, and utility within constraints. Technical Fluency Comfortable with data systems, ML workflows, and APIs; capable of partnering closely with engineering and research. Understands data-infrastructure constraints and can navigate tradeoffs with confidence. Curious about emerging AI-native interface paradigms (copilots, natural-language UX, etc.). Operational Excellence Skilled at designing scalable product processes and operating cadences. Uses metrics to inform decisions without losing product intuition. Collaborates effectively with Delivery, Engineering, and Research. Team Building & Mentorship Proven ability to hire, develop, and retain exceptional PM and design talent. Creates an environment of ownership, clarity, and psychological safety. Leads with warmth, rigor, and taste. Executive Communication Clear, concise communicator who inspires confidence. Capable of telling compelling product stories to customers, board members, and investors. Balances high-level strategy with grounded execution detail. Preferred Background 7+ years in product and/or design leadership at high-growth tech companies, ideally at the intersection of AI, data, or enterprise SaaS. Experience building expert networks, marketplaces, or human-in-the-loop systems. Prior entrepreneurial or founding experience strongly preferred. Deep understanding of AI, data labeling, or research-tooling ecosystems. Strong design instincts backed by a portfolio or product examples. Bachelor's or advanced degree in Computer Science, Design, or a related field. What They Offer: $240k – $300k (Final compensation will depend on experience, skill level, and location.) Equity Comprehensive Benefits

title: Product Manager II, Fanless Embedded Computers
description: Job Title: Product Manager II, Fanless Embedded Computers Location(s): Irvine, CA - Onsite Compensation: $86,500 – $108,000 Exempt (Salaried) + Bonus About this position : Advantech is seeking a Product Manager to lead strategic initiatives and support project inquiries for our embedded product lines. This role will focus on developing localized go-to-market (GTM) strategies by identifying customer needs and pain points to drive engagement with both sales teams and end customers. The Product Manager will actively support project opportunities to help secure deals, collaborating closely with local partners and customers to foster business and solution alignment. Success in this role requires strong cross-functional collaboration to ensure effective product positioning, demand generation, and overall business growth. Responsibilities : Define and develop localized strategies for Advantech's embedded product lines (https://www.advantech.com/en-us/embedded-boards-design-in-services), focusing on selected products and collaborating with product managers and marketing teams to consolidate product promotion and planning efforts. Support project management activities, including product specification clarification, proposal preparation, quotation definition, meeting facilitation, and progress tracking. Define and execute product promotional strategies, including online and offline marketing plans, internal training sessions, webinars, and collaboration with sales teams, partners, or customers. Establish, manage, and maintain strong relationships with customers and partners to ensure long-term collaboration and enhance customer satisfaction. Coordinate cross-functional teams, including application engineers, supply chain, procurement, quality control, and manufacturing, to ensure timely project development. Manage product phase-in and phase-out processes, including announcements, documentation updates, and database maintenance. Address product and project-related quality issues by collaborating with the quality department, HQ product teams, and engineering teams to resolve any challenges effectively. Communicate with overseas counterparts (Taiwan/China) regarding product and project-related action items, which may require occasional late-hour meetings. Business travel may be required for events or customer visits (approximately 10-15% travel per year). Required Qualifications : Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field is preferred. 5+ years of experience in product management, project management, or product engineering within the PC industry or related fields. title: Senior Product Manager, eDiscovery
description: WHAT IS BOX? Box (NYSE:BOX) is the leader in Intelligent Content Management. Our platform enables organizations to fuel collaboration, manage the entire content lifecycle, secure critical content, and transform business workflows with enterprise AI. We help companies thrive in the new AI-first era of business. Founded in 2005, Box simplifies work for leading global organizations, including JLL, Morgan Stanley, and Nationwide. Box is headquartered in Redwood City, CA, with offices across the United States, Europe, and Asia. By joining Box, you will have the unique opportunity to continue driving our platform forward. Content powers how we work. It's the billions of files and information flowing across teams, departments, and key business processes every single day: contracts, invoices, employee records, financials, product specs, marketing assets, and more. Our mission is to bring intelligence to the world of content management and empower our customers to completely transform workflows across their organizations. With the combination of AI and enterprise content, the opportunity has never been greater to transform how the world works together and at Box you will be on the front lines of this massive shift. WHY BOX NEEDS YOU Box is looking to hire a Senior Product Manager for eDiscovery products to enhance its offerings in legal hold, content collection, and future legal compliance products. As organizations increasingly prioritize data security and compliance, the need for effective eDiscovery tools has never been greater. This role will focus on developing strategies that ensure users can manage their content efficiently while adhering to legal requirements. By leading these initiatives, the Senior Product Manager will play a crucial part in helping businesses efficiently comply with their legal requirements. WHAT YOU'LL DO Product Strategy Development : Define and refine the product vision and strategy for Legal Holds, Content Collection, and future eDiscovery strategies. Stakeholder Collaboration : Work closely with cross-functional teams including engineering, design, marketing, and sales to gather requirements and ensure successful product delivery. Market Research : Conduct research on industry trends, customer needs, and competitor offerings to inform product decisions and identify opportunities for innovation. Roadmap Management : Create and maintain the product roadmap, prioritizing features based on customer feedback, business impact, and resource availability. User Experience Oversight : Collaborate with UX/UI designers to create intuitive user interfaces that enhance user experience while meeting compliance standards. Performance Analysis : Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to eDiscovery products; analyze data to drive improvements in functionality or user engagement. Customer Engagement : Engage with customers through interviews or surveys to gather insights about their experiences with the products; use this feedback for continuous improvement. Compliance Monitoring : Stay updated on regulatory changes affecting eDiscovery and legal operations; ensure that products meet the rigorous legal standards required by organizations. WHO YOU ARE 5+ years in eDiscovery, with a focus on the matter management frameworks and best practices for end-to-end legal matter management. 5+ years of experience in product management, with a proven track record of developing and launching successful products that meet market needs. Ability to analyze data, user feedback, and market trends to inform product decisions, optimize features, and drive strategic initiatives. Proven ability to work effectively with diverse teams—including engineering, design, marketing, and sales—to ensure alignment on product goals and deliverables. Experience applying user-centered design principles to create intuitive products that enhance the user experience while addressing customer pain points. Strong project management abilities to oversee product development timelines, budgets, resources efficiently while ensuring timely delivery of high-quality products. Excellent verbal and written communication skills for articulating product vision clearly to stakeholders at all levels and facilitating productive discussions. Familiarity with the EDiscovery Reference Model and it's impact to content providers. Understanding of technology stacks related to cloud storage solutions or enterprise software applications relevant to eDiscovery products enhances collaboration with technical teams. Ability to develop long-term strategies for product growth while aligning them with the company's overall goals ensures sustained success in a competitive landscape. Box lives its values, with community and in-person collaboration being a core part of our culture. Boxers are expected to work from their assigned office a minimum of 3 days per week, with a focus on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Your recruiter will share more about how we work and company culture during the hiring process. Head-over-heels about this role — but not sure you meet all the requirements? Apply anyway! Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Box, we take a big-picture approach to hiring that fosters authenticity, diversity, and inclusion. If you're passionate about this opportunity, chances are, you shine pretty bright. EQUAL OPPORTUNITY We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, and any other protected ground of discrimination under applicable human rights legislation. Box strives to respect the dignity and ‎‎independence of people with disabilities and is committed to giving them the same ‎‎opportunity to succeed as all other employees. Inclusiveness is core to our culture at Box, and we strive to ensure you get the most from your interview experience. Box makes reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities. If a reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please complete this form. Reasonable accommodations may include scheduling adjustments, document dictation and beyond. Notice to applicants in Los Angeles: Box, Inc and its related branches will consider for employment, qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Los Angeles Fair Chair Ordinance. The Fair Chance Ordinance is provided here. Notice to applicants in San Francisco: Box, Inc and its related branches will consider for employment, qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chair Ordinance. The Fair Chance Ordinance is provided here. For details on how we protect your information when you apply, please see our Personnel Privacy Notice. If you are a California-resident, please read our California Applicant & Candidate Privacy Notice here.

description: CDS Full Time Event Manager - Product Demonstration Club Demonstration Services (CDS) is in need of an Event Manager responsible for the recruitment, hiring and supervision of in store Product Demonstrators. This position requires strong communication between warehouse managers, vendors and in store Product Demonstrators including participation in new location grand openings. CDS is the preferred in-house event marketing provider to Costco. We offer the best person-to-person marketing services in the industry, driving sales for our customers and Costco. APPLY TODAY! What We Offer: Set schedule of Tuesday-Saturday from 8:30AM – 5:30PM (may vary based on needs) Work-life balance! Full Time Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, Life) Short and Long-Term Disability 401(K) plan Generous paid time off Responsibilities: Recruit, train and hire part-time staff. Oversee product preparation and presentation, including food safety and sanitation. Train Product Demonstrators in demonstration preparation and excellent customer services. Two to four years of related experience in retail, hospitality, or food environments. Detail oriented with excellent leadership and communication skills. Proven ability to lead well performing teams. Ability to exercise independent judgement. Able to coach and counsel employees, take correct measures as needs. Flexibility and ability to work in a fast paced environment Job Will Remain Open Until Filled
