title: Senior Product Manager, Growth Modalities
description: About the Company: World is a network of real humans, built on privacy-preserving proof-of-human technology, and powered by a globally inclusive financial network that enables the free flow of digital assets for all. It is built to connect, empower, and be owned by everyone. About the Team People spend fifteen seconds with an Orb, but a lifetime with the World App. As such, the App team plays a critical role in fulfilling our mission. Using the App, people can join the World network, participate in decentralized finance in a friendly and self-custodial manner, and use their World ID to unlock services across the ecosystem. The Growth team is responsible for driving World's biggest priority across the entirety of the business: reaching critical scale. About the Opportunity: As a Senior Product Manager, Growth Modalities at Tools for Humanity, you will shape how millions of people around the world experience the core of World: Orb verification. From discovering an Orb nearby to booking an appointment, showing up, and completing verification, you'll own the end-to-end journey that brings new users into the World ecosystem. Own the end-to-end Orb verification journey, from discovery, booking to in-person verification, guiding the user through the verification process and explaining newfound World ID benefits. Design and scale multiple verification modalities, included guided operator-led, self-serve, Orb-on-demand experiences, and decentralized operations. Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, hardware, marketing, and operations teams to make verification seamless, efficient, and globally scalable. Drive growth and accessibility, ensuring more people around the world can easily find and complete their Orb verification. Lead service design improvements, optimizing both the digital and real-world touchpoints of the user experience. Partner with hardware teams to align product strategy with physical deployment and performance of Orbs in the field. Use data, research, and experimentation to identify friction points, validate new verification models, and improve conversion rates. Champion localization and regional adaptation, ensuring that verification processes are culturally relevant and operationally viable in diverse markets. Collaborate closely with operators and field partners, incorporating real-world feedback into product and process improvements. Travel internationally to key markets to observe, test, and refine verification experiences alongside users and teams in the field. Influence cross-functional stakeholders, driving alignment and execution on global growth and service design priorities. About You: You have 8+ years of experience as a Product Manager, with a strong background in growth, service design, or operationally complex products. You've worked in international markets and understand the importance of localization, cultural nuance, and regional adaptability in global products. You have experience with products that interact with hardware or have physical components, ideally in logistics, retail, IoT, or mobility contexts. You're passionate about building intuitive, high-quality experiences that make complex real-world processes simple and delightful. You're data-driven and experimentation-minded, able to use insights and research to improve conversion, efficiency, and user satisfaction. You thrive in cross-functional environments, collaborating across product, engineering, hardware, marketing, and operations teams to deliver impact. You're excited to travel around the world working in the field—observing users, engaging with operators, and learning directly from real-world environments. You're motivated by global scale and human impact, eager to help expand access to World's verification experience across the world. Pay transparency statement (for CA and NY based roles): The reasonably estimated salary for this role at TFH ranges from $220,000 - $280,000 , plus a competitive long term incentive package. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, TFH offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, vision, 401(k) plan and match, life insurance, flexible time off, commuter benefits, professional development stipend and much more! By submitting your application, you consent to the processing and internal sharing of your CV within the company, in compliance with the GDPR

title: Senior Product Manager, Growth Incentives
description: About the Company: World is a network of real humans, built on privacy-preserving proof-of-human technology, and powered by a globally inclusive financial network that enables the free flow of digital assets for all. It is built to connect, empower, and be owned by everyone. About the Team People spend fifteen seconds with an Orb, but a lifetime with the World App. As such, the App team plays a critical role in fulfilling our mission. Using the App, people can join the World network, participate in decentralized finance in a friendly and self-custodial manner, and use their World ID to unlock services across the ecosystem. The Growth team is responsible for driving World's biggest priority across the entirety of the business: reaching critical scale. About the Opportunity: As a Senior Product Manager, Growth Incentives at Tools for Humanity, you'll drive one of the most strategically important areas of World's growth and scale: Our global incentive programs. Today, incentives such as the Worldcoin airdrop and referral programs are key drivers of our expansion, representing investments in the tens of millions of dollars each month. You'll own and optimize these programs, ensuring they are efficient, data-informed, and impactful in driving sustainable user growth. Own and optimize World's incentive programs, including the Worldcoin airdrop and referral systems, which drive the majority of current growth. Manage multi-million dollar monthly incentive budgets, ensuring programs are effective, efficient, and aligned with long-term growth goals. Design, test, and launch new incentive models that attract, activate, and retain users while maintaining sustainable unit economics. Collaborate cross-functionally with product, economics, finance, data science, marketing, fraud prevention and regional teams to scale global incentive initiatives. Leverage data and experimentation to measure program effectiveness, identify optimization opportunities, and inform strategic decisions. Model incentive performance and ROI, partnering with finance and data teams to assess cost efficiency and user impact. Ensure localization and regional relevance of incentive programs to maximize engagement and effectiveness in diverse international markets. Champion a culture of analytical rigor and experimentation, setting high standards for measurement and learning velocity. Influence and align stakeholders across the organization, communicating insights, recommendations, and trade-offs with clarity and confidence. About You: You have 8+ years of experience as a Product Manager focused on growth, incentives, or performance-based product initiatives. You've owned or scaled large incentive programs - such as referral systems, cashback offers, or user reward campaigns - with proven impact on user acquisition and retention. You bring a strong analytical and data-driven mindset, with the ability to interpret complex data and model incentive outcomes. You have a background in economics, data science, or quantitative problem-solving, or equivalent hands-on experience managing incentive-driven systems. You thrive in fast-paced, high-growth environments, using experimentation and iteration to uncover what drives sustainable user engagement. You've worked in international markets and understand how localization and cultural context influence user motivation and incentives. You are curious, creative, and impact-oriented, motivated by building systems that power global growth at scale. Obsessed with building delightful products, placing great care on user experience. You have a bias towards action, a high sense of urgency, and a willingness to roll up your sleeves to get things done. Pay transparency statement (for CA and NY based roles): The reasonably estimated salary for this role at TFH ranges from $220,000 - $280,000 , plus a competitive long term incentive package. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, TFH offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, vision, 401(k) plan and match, life insurance, flexible time off, commuter benefits, professional development stipend and much more! title: Senior Product Manager, Growth Lifecycle
description: About the Company: World is a network of real humans, built on privacy-preserving proof-of-human technology, and powered by a globally inclusive financial network that enables the free flow of digital assets for all. It is built to connect, empower, and be owned by everyone. About the Team People spend fifteen seconds with an Orb, but a lifetime with the World App. As such, the App team plays a critical role in fulfilling our mission. Using the App, people can join the World network, participate in decentralized finance in a friendly and self-custodial manner, and use their World ID to unlock services across the ecosystem. The Growth team is responsible for driving World's biggest priority across the entirety of the business: reaching critical scale. About the Opportunity: As a Senior Product Manager, Growth Lifecycle at Tools for Humanity, you will own the full user journey; from acquisition and onboarding through activation, retention, and long-term engagement. This is a critical, high-impact role at the heart of World's growth and scale, driving the most strategically important parts of our user experience. Own the entire user lifecycle: From acquisition and onboarding to activation, retention, and engagement - driving measurable growth across all stages. Lead and optimize the onboarding experience, including "get started" guides and first-time user flows, to ensure smooth activation and early success. Design and manage user communications, including in-app messages, push notifications, and lifecycle campaigns that deepen engagement and retention. Collaborate cross-functionally with product, design, data science, engineering, and marketing to align on growth strategies and execute at scale. Own and evolve the World App homepage, leveraging machine learning to deliver personalized, context-aware content and smart user suggestions. Use data and experimentation to identify growth opportunities, run A/B tests, and measure the impact of product changes across key lifecycle metrics. Champion a strong culture of experimentation, using insights to continuously improve onboarding, engagement, and retention initiatives. Advocate for global users, ensuring product experiences are localized, culturally relevant, and impactful in diverse international markets. Influence across the organization, driving alignment on growth priorities and inspiring teams to execute effectively against shared goals. Bring prior hands-on experience in managing user activation and retention at scale, leveraging both product intuition and analytical rigor. About You: You have 8+ years of experience as a Product Manager, with a proven track record driving growth across activation, retention, and engagement funnels. You are experienced in Performance Marketing, SEO. You are highly data-driven, comfortable digging into metrics, collaborating with analysts and data scientists, and making evidence-based decisions. You've worked in international or multi-market environments, and understand the importance of localization and cultural nuance in driving global growth. You're both strategic and execution-oriented. You're able to define the vision for lifecycle growth while ensuring measurable progress toward key outcomes. Proven ability to design processes, navigate ambiguous environments, and synthesize high-level goals into actionable roadmaps. Obsessed with building delightful products, placing great care on user experience. You have a bias towards action, a high sense of urgency, and a willingness to roll up your sleeves to get things done. title: Senior Platform Product Manager
description: At Movius, we solve a critical gap companies face with employee-to-client communication over voice and messaging. We are the leading global provider of Secure Communication as a Service (SCaaS™). Our flagship solution, MultiLine™, enhances workflows, resolves compliance gaps and unifies cross-channel messaging. Movius AI-powered solutions enable businesses to build strong and lasting relationships with their customers in a company-owned, controllable system. Welcome to Phone 3.0™. Headquartered in Alpharetta, GA, with offices in Silicon Valley, Bangalore, India, New York, and London, Movius partners with leading global wireless carriers like T-Mobile, Vodafone, TELUS, BT, Singtel & more. To learn more about Movius, visit www.movius.ai. Senior Platform Product Manager Build the foundation. Empower innovation. Shape the future. We're looking for a visionary Senior Platform Product Manager to lead the charge in crafting a world-class platform that powers our products, teams, and customers. If you thrive at the intersection of strategy, technology, and execution—and love building tools that developers actually want to use—this is your moment. You'll be the driving force behind our platform's evolution, partnering with engineering, architecture, design, and business leaders to deliver scalable, resilient, and developer-friendly solutions. This isn't just a product role—it's a chance to help architect the backbone of our company's growth. What You'll Own & Drive Define a bold, forward-looking platform strategy that aligns with company goals and anticipates future needs across teams and technologies Own the platform roadmap end-to-end. Prioritize initiatives that deliver real business impact, technical excellence, and long-term scalability. Translate complex challenges into clear product requirements, user stories, and use cases that inspire and guide engineering. Collaborate deeply with engineering leads, architects, and designers to bring platform features to life with precision and speed. Be the voice of the platform. Build strong relationships with internal teams to gather feedback and champion platform capabilities. Speak the language of APIs, infrastructure, data models, and cloud architecture. Bridge business needs with technical realities. Monitor industry trends, emerging tech, and competitor platforms to inform strategy and spark innovation. Define and track KPIs for platform adoption, reliability, and developer satisfaction. Articulate platform capabilities and roadmaps to technical and non-technical audiences with clarity and confidence. What You Bring Bachelor's in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (MBA a plus) 5+ years in product management, with 2+ years focused on platform, API, or infrastructure products Proven success launching platform products that delivered measurable business value Strong technical foundation—cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), APIs, data systems, and SDLC Sharp analytical skills and a data-first mindset Exceptional communicator and collaborator across all levels Comfortable navigating ambiguity and thriving in fast-paced environments Experience with Agile frameworks (Scrum, Kanban) Bonus Points Hands-on experience with technologies like Kubernetes, Kafka, GraphQL, or ML platforms Cybersecurity expertise in SaaS environments Industry experience in FinTech, E-commerce, Healthcare, or SaaS Passion for building and nurturing developer communities Why Join Us? This is more than a job—it's a chance to build something foundational. You'll shape the tools that power innovation across our company and beyond. If you're ready to lead with vision, execute with precision, and make a lasting impact, we want to meet you.

title: Senior Product Manager - Workload Intelligence
description: Snowflake is about empowering enterprises to achieve their full potential — and people too. With a culture that's all in on impact, innovation, and collaboration, Snowflake is the sweet spot for building big, moving fast, and taking technology — and careers — to the next level. We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to join our core Analytics team, focusing on SQL workload optimization. This role will have a significant impact on Snowflake's core product experience and extend our industry lead in "ease-of-optimization." This is a critical, high-visibility role for an "AI-native" product leader. Snowflake customers have high expectations! You will be responsible for defining the vision, roadmap, and GTM strategy for Snowflake's SQL workload optimization features, and executing on them with relentless urgency, focus, and ownership. To succeed in this role, you need to be an experienced, "full-stack" product leader who is equally comfortable in deep-dives with customer architects, leading contentious product debates with senior leadership, and unblocking critical go-to-market dependencies. AS A SENIOR PRODUCT MANAGER AT SNOWFLAKE YOU WILL: Be the single-threaded owner for the end-to-end product lifecycle, from defining the vision, strategy and roadmap, to ensuring the rapid, on-time, and meticulous execution across all dependencies. Define and execute the roadmap for new workload optimization experiences, including agentic GenAI-powered tools. Own the "ease-of-optimization" experience , partnering closely with design and engineering to ensure our solutions are not just functional, but are also elegant and easy to use. Conduct continuous customer and competitive research to identify, validate, and prioritize the most impactful opportunities. Lead effectively across functions and orgs, building deep trust with engineering and design partners to unblock dependencies, rally teams through setbacks, and ensure a successful launch. Communicate the strategy and status of your area concisely and clearly to stakeholders and senior leadership. Be the external face of workload optimization , engaging with customers, partners, and the broader community (e.g., at events like Snowflake Summit). OUR IDEAL SENIOR PRODUCT MANAGER WILL HAVE: Strong technical product management experience : 7+ years of experience in product management 5+ years of experience with data analytics, databases, or distributed systems A strong understanding of the AI data platform landscape A bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar Demonstrable "AI-native" product management experience : You have a proven track record of shipping successful AI-enabled features and using GenAI tools to accelerate product development. High-judgment product design skills. You have a strong point of view on what makes a great user experience and the ability to guide the team toward it. A "shipping" obsession with a bias for action. You make fast, high-quality decisions, and collaborate across teams to solve problems quickly. High ownership and resilience, low ego . You own outcomes, good or bad. You actively seek critical feedback, galvanize your team, and know when to disagree and commit. An expert ability to lead through ambiguity and debate . You are comfortable challenging longstanding assumptions and have a reputation for making the muddy clear. Excellent "championing" skills . You can align cross-org teams around a compelling vision, and win the resources they need. A passion for tackling challenging problems in a rapidly evolving company and industry. BONUS POINTS FOR EXPERIENCE WITH THE FOLLOWING: Prior experience working on SQL workload optimization and cloud data warehouses, whether as a customer, partner, integrator Experience with data services in public clouds (AWS, Azure, GCP) Snowflake is growing fast, and we're scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake. How do you want to make your impact? For jobs located in the United States, please visit the job posting on the Snowflake Careers Site for salary and benefits information: careers.snowflake.com The following represents the expected range of compensation for this role: The estimated base salary range for this role is $200,000 - $287,500. Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Snowflake's bonus and equity plan. The successful candidate's starting salary will be determined based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and geographic location. This role is also eligible for a competitive benefits package that includes: medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance; 401(k) retirement plan; flexible spending & health savings account; at least 12 paid holidays; paid time off; parental leave; employee assistance program; and other company benefits. To comply with pay transparency requirements and other statutes, you can notify us if you believe that a job posting is not compliant by completing this form.

title: Group Product Marketing Manager, Chrome Browser, Marketing
description: Applicants in San Francisco: Qualified applications with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act. Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Mountain View, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA . Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 13 years of experience in marketing with inbound product marketing for technology products. 5 years of experience with people management. Experience managing cross-functional or cross-team projects and building trusted partnerships with Product and Engineering leadership to craft product strategy and narratives. Preferred qualifications: Experience driving projects from concept to launch in product marketing. Ability to influence at all levels, including at the executive level and to work effectively across multiple functions. Excellent at delivering impactful marketing in undefined spaces without relying on pre-existing playbooks. Excellent people leader with a track record of coaching and mentoring individuals and testing the team to innovate and think differently. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with distinctive thought leadership and problem-solving skills. Passion for consumer tech and AI with a pulse on industry trends and how technology is evolving across Google. About the job Chrome's mission is to make the web work better for billions of users. By delivering the most helpful and safest browsing experience powered by Google's AI, our goal is to grow Chrome on all platforms and secure our place at the heart of the user's digital life and Google's success. As the Group Product Marketing Manager for Chrome, you will own the mission of defining and transforming our product narrative to solidify Chrome's position as the essential browser for the AI era.In this role, you will become the visionary behind Chrome's core messaging, shaping the roadmap and leading a team to execute ambitious, groundbreaking launches. You will lead all inbound marketing efforts, clearly articulating Chrome's unique value that will boost user adoption and engagement. You will translate insights into a direction that influences both product and marketing campaigns. You will mentor a team of product marketers, acting as a player-coach to drive critical projects and elevate the team's capabilities, ensuring we deliver on our ambitious goals.Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems-from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can-changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself. The US base salary range for this full-time position is $211,000-$297,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process. Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google. Responsibilities Craft a compelling product narrative that clearly articulates Chrome's leadership and unique value in the age of AI. Partner with Product and Engineering to influence the roadmap and ensure Chrome remains at the forefront of AI innovation. Lead impactful launch strategies and campaigns that showcase Chrome's groundbreaking AI experiences and ongoing commitment to users. Develop an understanding of user needs and behaviors in a rapidly evolving landscape. Inform product strategy and marketing campaigns, ensuring our messaging resonates and solidifies Chrome's leadership position. Act as a player-coach to a high performing team, fostering a culture that issues the status quo and pioneers fresh, new approaches to deliver on Chrome's ambitious AI strategy. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: R&D / New Product Introduction Leader
description: R&D / New Product Introduction Leader Van Nuys, CA DEPARTMENT: Technology REPORTS TO: VP Technology POSITION PURPOSE: The R&D / New Product Introduction Leader will play a pivotal role in advancing Capstone Green Energy's technology and product portfolio, guiding innovative microturbine solutions from concept through commercialization. This role bridges strategic technological development with hands-on experimentation, ensuring that new products are technologically advanced, cost-effective, and aligned with customer and market needs. The successful candidate will be both a visionary and a tinkerer — someone energized by exploring ideas, testing limits, and breaking down complex problems to uncover why systems don't work as expected. This role requires curiosity, resilience, and a passion for iteration, with the ability to turn lessons learned into practical solutions that drive progress. Reporting to the Vice President of Technology , this individual will lead multidisciplinary teams while also rolling up their sleeves to prototype, stress-test, and refine. The R&D / New Product Introduction Leader will be expected to think boldly, experiment relentlessly, and foster a culture of innovation and continuous improvement that accelerates Capstone Green Energy's competitive advantage. Duties and Responsibilities Lead the strategic planning and execution of R&D initiatives and new product introductions (NPI) from concept through market launch. Develop and manage technology roadmaps, ensuring alignment with the company's product strategy and customer requirements. Collaborate closely with Sales, Marketing, and Product Management teams to define product specifications, business cases, and market entry strategies. Responsible for ensuring effective collaboration with Operations and Supply Chain to guarantee a seamless transition from development to full-scale manufacturing. Oversee cross-functional teams in engineering design, prototyping, qualification, and transition into manufacturing. Manage technical, schedule, and budgetary aspects of projects, ensuring adherence to milestones and delivery of objectives. Establish partnerships with external vendors, universities, and research institutions for technology advancement and innovation. Ensure compliance with industry regulations, quality standards, and company policies throughout the product lifecycle. Mentor and develop R&D staff, fostering an environment of continuous learning, innovation, and high performance. Provide technical oversight and perform critical reviews to ensure projects meet or exceed established standards. Participate actively in intellectual property strategy, including patent filings and protection strategies. Skills and Abilities Required Demonstrated expertise in power generation or in related fields such as automotive, aircraft engines, or other complex energy systems. Proven ability to effectively lead multidisciplinary teams in product development and technology innovation. Strong experience in managing product lifecycles from concept through commercialization. Solid understanding of project management principles, including schedule, budget, and risk management. Excellent negotiation, communication, and leadership skills. Ability to translate complex technical requirements into actionable engineering and business plans. Strategic thinker with a balance of innovation and practical execution capabilities. Proficiency in relevant engineering tools, CAD software, and simulation/modeling techniques. Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and manage multiple concurrent projects effectively. Preferred Qualifications Expertise in microturbine technologies. Proven track record of leading new product introduction, ideally within microturbine, energy generation, or related industries. Experience with regulatory compliance and standards relevant to power generation. PMP certification or equivalent project management credentials (highly desirable). Education and Experience Desired Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Systems Engineering, or a related field required; Master's degree preferred. Minimum 5 years of relevant engineering, product development, and test experience. Work Environment This position is based on-site at our Van Nuys, CA office. Typical office environment with significant time spent in R&D labs and manufacturing facilities. Ability to perform extended periods of computer-based tasks and attend to project activities beyond a standard workweek as required. This role may require work beyond a standard 8-hour day, including occasional evenings or weekends, to support critical project milestones or operational needs. The salary range for this position is $135,000 – $170,000 annually.

title: Senior Product Manager
description: About Us Chorus Innovations is a fast-growing healthcare technology company with an adaptive platform as a service (PaaS) that enables the rapid development of mobile, desktop, text messaging and interactive voice applications. Chorus' platform currently powers transformative healthcare, biomedical research and community health projects across institutions and public health agencies nationwide. We believe every community should have world-class health technology so they can thrive. Our mission is to improve the lives of people and communities by democratizing technology development in health and research. About the Role As a Senior Product Manager, you will own the vision, strategy, and evolution of key product lines within the Chorus platform. You will translate market needs, client patterns, and platform capabilities into clear product direction—balancing strategic foresight with the pragmatism needed to drive outcomes in a complex healthcare ecosystem. You will work at the intersection of R&D, Delivery, and Go-To-Market, ensuring each product area has well-defined goals, reusable templates, and a roadmap that reduces swirl, increases reuse, and unlocks scalable growth. You'll define problems deeply, synthesize insights from users, clinical experts, research, and stakeholders, and convert them into product requirements, sequencing, and standards that elevate how solutions are built across Chorus. As a senior leader on the Product team, you will champion clarity, prioritization, and measurable impact. You will shape product narratives, guide cross-functional alignment, and create the artifacts—requirements, stories, templates, and playbooks—that enable both Delivery teams and external partners to move faster with higher quality. Your work ensures that each product line evolves intentionally, customers experience consistent value, and the platform advances toward our long-term vision of intelligent, scalable healthcare infrastructure. What You'll Be Doing Define the vision and roadmap for behavioral health workflows across intake, referrals, crisis response, care coordination, and ongoing case management. Translate real-world behavioral health practices, policy changes, and user insights into clear product requirements, workflow definitions, and reusable templates. Partner with Clinical Solutions, Design, Engineering, and Delivery to ensure features are feasible, well-sequenced, and aligned to product standards and platform capabilities. Identify cross-client patterns to create scalable, repeatable modules that reduce customization and accelerate delivery. Drive FHIR-aligned workflow and data model design, ensuring behavioral health workflows integrate cleanly with EHRs, EDWs, crisis systems, and external partners through modern interoperability standards. Prioritize roadmap decisions based on user value, strategic impact, regulatory alignment, and long-term scalability. Measure product performance and user outcomes to inform iteration and continuous improvement. Support GTM, Partner Success, and Delivery teams with clear product artifacts that improve scoping, demos, and client alignment. What We're Looking For 5+ years of product management experience owning features or product lines through discovery, definition, delivery, and iteration. Strong ability to map complex behavioral health workflows—gathering requirements, synthesizing user research, and translating real-world scenarios into clear product specifications and reusable patterns. Deep understanding of healthcare interoperability, especially FHIR, HL7, and EHR/EDW integration models, with the ability to align workflows and data across systems. Proven success launching workflow-heavy products and driving measurable impact across clinicians, care teams, and administrators. Effective cross-functional partner to Engineering, Design, Clinical Solutions, Delivery, Data, and GTM teams, with strong communication and alignment skills. Analytical thinker skilled at using data, feedback, and usage insights to refine workflows and inform roadmap decisions. Experience in healthcare, behavioral health, public health, or similarly complex regulated environments. Familiarity with Agile methodologies, including backlog refinement and iteration planning. BS/BA in a relevant field; technical or clinical background helpful but not required. Why Join Us? A mission-driven company – be part of a team that is helping to improve people's lives by democratizing technology development in health! Full medical, dental, vision and life insurance benefits 401K plan Company stock options Unlimited paid vacation Performance bonuses Company support for career and skill development Fun company events and outings Chorus is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity and inclusion Compensation Disclosure The anticipated base salary range for this position is $140,000 – $170,000 in the Los Angeles market. Actual offers depend on skills, experience, and location, and may include additional components such as performance bonuses, stock options, and benefits. Chorus Innovations is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a diverse team. We welcome applicants of every background and provide reasonable accommodations throughout the hiring process. If you need assistance, email careers@joinchorus.com Chorus Innovations values diversity as a core principle of the work we do and the communities we serve. We are committed to equal employment opportunity, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religious creed, citizenship, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex, sexual orientation, military and veteran status, gender, gender identity, gender expression, or any other protected characteristic. Disability Accommodation for Applicants to Chorus Innovations At Chorus Innovations, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible workplace environment for all individuals, including job applicants with disabilities. We recognize the value that individuals with diverse abilities bring to our organization and are dedicated to providing equal opportunities for all applicants. If you require accommodations at any stage of the job application process due to a disability, please inform us of your needs. We will do our best to work with you to ensure that reasonable accommodations are made to facilitate your participation in the recruitment process. Please note that accommodations will be provided in a manner that respects your privacy and confidentiality. Disclosing a disability or requesting accommodations will not affect your candidacy or opportunities for employment with Chorus Innovations. To request accommodations or discuss your needs further, please contact careers@joinchorus.com. We encourage you to reach out as early as possible to ensure that appropriate arrangements can be made. Thank you for considering Chorus Innovations as a potential employer. We look forward to the opportunity to work together and to creating an inclusive workplace where all individuals can thrive.

title: Senior Product Manager, Consumer Payments and Retention
description: Teamwork makes the stream work. Roku is changing how the world watches TV Roku is the #1 TV streaming platform in the U.S., Canada, and Mexico, and we've set our sights on powering every television in the world. Roku pioneered streaming to the TV. Our mission is to be the TV streaming platform that connects the entire TV ecosystem. We connect consumers to the content they love, enable content publishers to build and monetize large audiences, and provide advertisers unique capabilities to engage consumers. From your first day at Roku, you'll make a valuable - and valued - contribution. We're a fast-growing public company where no one is a bystander. We offer you the opportunity to delight millions of TV streamers around the world while gaining meaningful experience across a variety of disciplines. About the Team The Subscriptions Product team at Roku is focused on growing Roku's subscriptions business by creating extraordinary experiences that allow our viewers to purchase and engage with subscription services. We collaborate closely with Engineering, UX, Legal, Business teams, and partners to deliver high-quality features and capabilities our users love. About the Role We're seeking a Senior Product Manager of Consumer Payments & Retention to own payment experience, compliance, and drive subscription retention efforts across the Roku ecosystem. For California Only - The estimated annual salary for this position is between $204,000 - $255,000 annually. Compensation packages are based on factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, certifications, and specific geographical location. This role is eligible for health insurance, equity awards, life insurance, disability benefits, parental leave, wellness benefits, and paid time off. What You'll Be Doing Enhance the consumer facing experiences, wherever Subscriptions from Roku are available, for adding and updating methods of payment with a goal of increasing purchase conversion. This includes at time of device activation or account creation, and at critical points through the consumer journey Drive method of payment enhancements, giving users a choice on how they purchase on Roku Define and ship retention mechanisms—smart cancellation save offers, win back pathways, and seamless discovery/subscription into other services Run A/B tests to quantify the impact of features and capabilities across the payment and retention portfolio Collaborate cross-functionally to operationalize payment and purchase compliance requirements in consumer flows and customer communications Partner with Customer Care to design clear, fair refund experiences and policies that balance user trust with operational efficiency We're Excited If You Have 5+ years of Product Management experience; consumer subscriptions/streaming experience strongly preferred Ability to engage deeply with Engineering on technical details to translate product requirements into scalable solutions; proven success delivering high-quality products on time Reputation as a strong collaborator who listens, builds consensus, makes clear decisions, and writes thoughtful requirements Track record of executing plans end-to-end: driving alignment, managing tradeoffs, and unblocking teams to ship reliably Comfort with instrumentation and experimentation at scale: conversion, churn, payment success, and partner health metrics Bonus: Proven track record shipping multi-country products: payments, tax/VAT/compliance, localization, and partner onboarding at scale Bachelor's degree (in Computer Science or a related technical field), MBA preferred #LI-SSC Benefits Roku is committed to offering a diverse range of benefits as part of our compensation package to support our employees and their families. Our comprehensive benefits include global access to mental health and financial wellness support and resources. Local benefits include statutory and voluntary benefits which may include healthcare (medical, dental, and vision), life, accident, disability, commuter, and retirement options (401(k)/pension). Our employees can take time off work for vacation and other personal reasons to balance their evolving work and life needs. It's important to note that not every benefit is available in all locations or for every role. For details specific to your location, please consult with your recruiter. The Roku Culture Roku is a great place for people who want to work in a fast-paced environment where everyone is focused on the company's success rather than their own. We try to surround ourselves with people who are great at their jobs, who are easy to work with, and who keep their egos in check. We appreciate a sense of humor. We believe a fewer number of very talented folks can do more for less cost than a larger number of less talented teams. We're independent thinkers with big ideas who act boldly, move fast and accomplish extraordinary things through collaboration and trust. In short, at Roku you'll be part of a company that's changing how the world watches TV. We have a unique culture that we are proud of. We think of ourselves primarily as problem-solvers, which itself is a two-part idea. We come up with the solution, but the solution isn't real until it is built and delivered to the customer. That penchant for action gives us a pragmatic approach to innovation, one that has served us well since 2002. To learn more about Roku, our global footprint, and how we've grown, visit https://www.weareroku.com/factsheet. By providing your information, you acknowledge that you want Roku to contact you about job roles, that you have read Roku's Applicant Privacy Notice, and understand that Roku will use your information as described in that notice. If you do not wish to receive any communications from Roku regarding this role or similar roles in the future, you may unsubscribe here at any time.
company_description: Roku is the #1 TV streaming platform in the U.S. Roku pioneered streaming to the TV. Our mission is to be the TV streaming platform that connects the entire TV ecosystem.

title: Product Marketing Manager, OT/IoT
description: Company Description Our Mission At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life. Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we're looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are. Who We Are We believe collaboration thrives in person. That's why most of our teams work from the office full time, with flexibility when it's needed. This model supports real-time problem-solving, stronger relationships, and the kind of precision that drives great outcomes. Job Description Your Career We recently introduced a major step forward in device protection: Palo Alto Networks Device Security, the evolution of Internet of Things (IoT)/operational technology (OT) security that empowers organizations to discover, assess, and proactively secure every device across their enterprise. As a Product Marketing Manager, OT/IoT you will be the voice and go-to-market driver for this innovative new solution. You will work closely with product management, GTM and other cross-functional stakeholders to define and execute the positioning, messaging and all marketing activities for this cutting edge cloud delivered security service. This includes: Developing narratives and materials that help customers understand the value of Device Security by effectively translating product capabilities into compelling messages that resonate with customers. Educating and exciting our sales, GTM, and field marketing teams on both the customer and business value of our products. Creating impactful product marketing content, including datasheets, whitepapers, blogs, and presentations. Contributing to the presentation of our vision for industrial device visibility and security at both internal and external events. Collaborating with the Product Management team to build a shared market and product vision, forming the foundation of your product marketing activities. Your Impact You'll work closely with Product Management to build a shared market and product vision, forming the foundation for all product marketing activities. As you grow, you'll become a subject matter expert and a valuable resource for our sales and field marketing teams. You'll play a crucial role in creating powerful product marketing content, including datasheets, whitepapers, blogs, and presentations. Leveraging your knowledge and passion of product marketing for high tech software or hardware (ex: Cloud or Cyber Security), you'll be able to simplify product capabilities into compelling messages and tools that resonate with customers. You'll have opportunities to present at internal and external events, where you'll showcase our vision for industrial device visibility and security. Qualifications Your Experience 5 plus years in product marketing and a strong desire to learn and grow in this field, security experience preferred Strong communication skills, both written and verbal Enthusiasm for creating and delivering presentations A genuine curiosity about technology and a desire to understand network and device security. A team player with a willingness to explore various aspects of marketing. Additional Information The Team Step into a marketing role at Palo Alto Networks, where your innovation drives global impact against escalating cyber threats in this era of AI. You'll seize the unique opportunity to develop cutting-edge strategies and compelling content while collaborating with industry-leading experts in the fast-paced cybersecurity landscape. Here, your creativity directly contributes to a safer digital future for everyone, fostering your growth and development in this ever-evolving market. Compensation Disclosure The compensation offered for this position will depend on qualifications, experience, and work location. For candidates who receive an offer at the posted level, the starting base salary (for non-sales roles) or base salary + commission target (for sales/commissioned roles) is expected to be between $131,000 - $212,500YR. The offered compensation may also include restricted stock units and a bonus. A description of our employee benefits may be found here. Our Commitment We're problem solvers that take risks and challenge cybersecurity's status quo. It's simple: we can't accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com. Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Is role eligible for Immigration Sponsorship? No. Please note that we will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.
company_description: Your career will have a global impact: one that protects our way of life in the digital age by preventing successful cyberattacks.

title: Senior Product Engineering Manager
description: Job Description The Analog and Connectivity Business Unit (A&C) is looking for a Senior Product Engineering Manager to join our team to drive and manage the product development of state-of-the-art Memory Interface products. This is a unique and exciting opportunity to work with a cross-functional team to bring a product to volume production starting from product conception to production release. The job scope includes but is not limited to, development of the test plan to ensure datasheet specifications are met. Own the qualification plan and the execution to comply with various JEDEC/AEC quality standards. Own product quality assessment through reliability tests. Collaborate with multi-functional teams such as Design, Test, Applications and Failure Analysis teams during first silicon debug and to root cause field failures. Creation and maintenance of product BOM. Monitor production data to address yield and quality deficiencies using statistical analysis. Responsibilities: Full PE product lifecycle ownership from concept to end of life with a focus on ensuring the delivery of the highest quality products to our end customers Definition of ATE test, qualification and manufacturing plans Product release into manufacturing with adherence to stringent tier 1-customer requirements Datasheet and automotive compliance reports Real time customer support for design, product and quality related issues Temperature/Voltage/Process characterization and production limit setting Product new product introduction and yield ownership Product BOM release and maintenance Excursion management for both suppliers and customers Use commercially available yield tools for yield improvement and monitoring, generate weekly reports and review with PE teams KPI achievement in product related deliverables including NPI execution and velocity, product cost (Gross margin improvements), product quality performance and failure analysis cycle times PAT, SYL, SBL, SPC limit and disposition optimizations to protect quality without excessive waste Qualifications Candidates must currently reside in San Jose, CA. Education: BS or MS in Electrical/Electronic Engineering. Minimum of 3-7 years years experience in product engineering. Prefer to have timing product experience Familiarity with ATE tester platforms (eg. Teradyne J750, Advantest 93K) Knowledge of analog and mix-signal circuitry and the common building blocks, device physics, test methodology and DFT knowledge Experience with common lab test equipment (DC power supply, oscilloscope, multi-meters etc). Bench characterization experience is a plus Familiarity with JEDEC/AEC qualification standards and stress test conditions. Experience with qualification hardware/software development would be preferred Experience in yield management tools such as PDF Exensio, JMP. Apply statistical analysis to isolate the issue and make data-driven decisions Ability to managing supplier excursions and customer escalations through problem solving Bench char experience is a plus Strong verbal and written communication skills A good team player. Effective in fast paced, dynamic work environment Applicants for this position must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. Renesas is unable to sponsor applicants for work visas for this position now or in the future. Additional Information The expected annual pay range for this position is $175K-$210K. This position is also eligible for bonus opportunities. Please note that final offer amount will be dependent on geographic location, applicable experience, and skillset of the candidate. Renesas offers a full range of elective benefits including medical, health savings account (with applicable medical plan), dental, vision, health and/or dependent care flexible spending accounts, pre-tax commuter benefits, life insurance, AD&D, and pet insurance. In addition to elective benefit options, benefited employees receive company-paid life insurance and AD&D, LTD, short term medical benefits as well as paid sick time, paid holidays, and accrued paid vacation. New employees will attend a detailed benefit orientation to learn more about our many benefits and resources. Renesas is an embedded semiconductor solution provider driven by its Purpose ' To Make Our Lives Easier .' As the industry's leading expert in embedded processing with unmatched quality and system-level know-how, we have evolved to provide scalable and comprehensive semiconductor solutions for automotive, industrial, infrastructure, and IoT industries based on the broadest product portfolio, including High Performance Computing, Embedded Processing, Analog & Connectivity, and Power. With a diverse team of over 22,000 professionals in more than 30 countries, we continue to expand our boundaries to offer enhanced user experiences through digitalization and usher into a new era of innovation. We design and develop sustainable, power-efficient solutions today that help people and communities thrive tomorrow, ' To Make Our Lives Easier .' At Renesas, you can: Launch and advance your career in technical and business roles across four Product Groups and various corporate functions. You will have the opportunities to explore our hardware and software capabilities and try new things. Make a real impact by developing innovative products and solutions to meet our global customers' evolving needs and help make people's lives easier, safe and secure. Maximize your performance and wellbeing in our flexible and inclusive work environment. Our people-first culture and global support system, including the remote work option and Employee Resource Groups, will help you excel from the first day. Are you ready to own your success and make your mark? Join Renesas. Shape Your Future with Us . Renesas Electronics is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, committed to celebrating diversity and fostering a work environment free of discrimination on the basis of sex, race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, military status, veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law. For more information, please read our Diversity & Inclusion Statement. Renesas Electronics deals with dual-use technology that is subject to U.S. export controls regulations. Under these regulations it may be necessary for Renesas to obtain U.S. government export license prior to release of technology to certain persons. The decision whether or not to file or pursue an export license application is at the sole discretion of Renesas. We have adopted a hybrid model that gives employees the ability to work remotely two days a week while ensuring that we come together as a team in the office the rest of the time. The designated in-office days are Tuesday through Thursday for innovation, collaboration and continuous learning.

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager (Hybrid based in San Francisco)
description: You will be based in our San Francisco or New York City office and will be required to be in office 3x/week. About Rippling Rippling gives businesses one place to run HR, IT, and Finance. It brings together all of the workforce systems that are normally scattered across a company, like payroll, expenses, benefits, and computers. For the first time ever, you can manage and automate every part of the employee lifecycle in a single system. Take onboarding, for example. With Rippling, you can hire a new employee anywhere in the world and set up their payroll, corporate card, computer, benefits, and even third-party apps like Slack and Microsoft 365—all within 90 seconds. Based in San Francisco, CA, Rippling has raised $1.4B+ from the world's top investors—including Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund, Sequoia, Greenoaks, and Bedrock—and was named one of America's best startup employers by Forbes. We prioritize candidate safety. Please be aware that all official communication will only be sent from @Rippling.com addresses. About the role We're looking for a Product Marketing Manager to translate Rippling's products and platform capabilities into powerful, performance-driven stories that inspire customers to act. This is not a traditional product marketing role, it's a hands-on marketing role for someone who can craft narratives, create assets, and ship campaigns that connect product innovation to customer outcomes. You'll build and maintain a solutions and automation use case marketing engine that spans product demo videos, landing pages, emails, and a growing library of modular creative assets, all designed to drive engagement, adoption, and expansion. The ideal candidate is a true marketer : someone who can uncover customer insights, write compelling copy, and create content that performs. You thrive in the gap between product and growth , turning technical value into tangible results. What you will do Develop and Own Solutions Marketing Frameworks Build a use case and automation library that connects Rippling's products to real customer problems and outcomes, with a strong focus on cross-product use cases and automation. Own the lifecycle of the use case library: build it, maintain it with new content, and make it engaging and "marketed," not just documented. Define messaging frameworks that position Rippling as a single, unified solution across people, spend, IT, and beyond. Highlight automation as a core value proposition, with specific examples of what customers can actually automate (e.g., triggering a Slack message when a rep exceeds quota and automating bonus payouts upon VP approval). Partner with GTM, corporate, and integrated marketing teams to ensure consistent storytelling across campaigns and customer touchpoints. Create and Ship Performance Marketing Content Write and produce emails, landing pages, ad copy, and coordinate demo videos that showcase Rippling's value in an engaging, measurable way. Translate complex product features into creative that converts, balancing clarity, storytelling, and performance. Test, analyze, and iterate on messaging to improve engagement and conversion rates. Develop content and campaigns around "automation recipes" or "playbooks" that demonstrate real-world automations. Work toward launching a public gallery of community-authored automation playbooks that customers can browse, deploy, and share. Lead Product-Connected Creative Campaigns Partner with GTM, brand, and product teams to identify marketing moments that align with feature launches or product updates. Develop performance-focused video content that highlights product functionality through a marketing lens. Build scalable creative templates and narratives that can be reused across lifecycle and growth programs. Launch "Automation of the Day" video content series for social media to showcase customer-created playbooks. Build engagement features such as leaderboards of top automations, newsletter spotlights, and awards programs recognizing the most innovative customer-created playbooks. Collaborate and Influence Across Teams Work cross-functionally with creative, product, and demand generation to align messaging across all channels. Support customer and field marketing teams with tailored assets and positioning for specific audiences or industries. Ensure the entire GTM org can articulate a consistent, compelling story about Rippling's solutions. Collaborate with customers and partners to co-market automation playbooks and drive community-led distribution. What you will need 3+ years in product marketing, or growth marketing at a B2B SaaS company. Strong copywriting and storytelling skills, you can write emails, scripts, and landing pages that drive measurable results. Experience creating video or performance creative tied to product launches or campaigns. Demonstrated ability to own the process end-to-end , from concepting and writing to testing and optimization. Data-informed and experiment-oriented: you use insights to refine messaging and creative direction. Ability to collaborate across marketing, creative, and product teams in a fast-paced, iterative environment. Growth mindset: eager to test, learn, and evolve Rippling's marketing storytelling model. Bonus points Experience developing short-form product demo or feature videos for performance marketing. Background in solutions or lifecycle marketing with strong familiarity in B2B SaaS. Portfolio of shipped marketing work , especially emails, landing pages, or campaign creative that shows both strategy and execution. Experience building community-led content libraries (e.g., playbooks, recipe galleries, or automation showcases). Additional Information Rippling is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce and do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other legally protected characteristics, Rippling is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities who need assistance during the hiring process. To request a reasonable accommodation, please email accomodations@rippling.com Rippling highly values having employees working in-office to foster a collaborative work environment and company culture. For office-based employees (employees who live within a defined radius of a Rippling office), Rippling considers working in the office, at least three days a week under current policy, to be an essential function of the employee's role. This role will receive a competitive salary + benefits + equity. The salary for US-based employees will be aligned with one of the ranges below based on location; see which tier applies to your location here. A variety of factors are considered when determining someone's compensation–including a candidate's professional background, experience, and location. Final offer amounts may vary from the amounts listed below. The pay range for this role is: 123,000 - 215,250 USD per year(US Tier 1)

title: Senior Manager, Product Offering
description: Description POSITION DESCRIPTION: We are looking for a Senior Manager for Product Offerings to join our Product Management team to lead the end-to-end development and lifecycle management of integrated energy offerings that combine advanced software, hardware, and financing models into scalable, customer-ready products. This role bridges technology and commercialization, and the ideal candidate will have experience in developing cohesive solutions made up of disparate individual technologies. They will work closely with Product, Engineering, Go-to-Market, Finance, EPC, and Business Development teams to design, validate, and launch offerings for the most complex energy customers. This position will be based out of San Francisco, Santa Clara, or Irvine, CA. RESPONSIBILITIES Define, design, and manage integrated energy offerings that bundle grid edge hardware (e.g., solar, battery storage, and gateways) and software (e.g., energy management, monitoring, and DERMs features) into cohesive, productized solutions. Drive the full offer lifecycle—from concept and feasibility through development, pilot, launch, and scaling—ensuring offerings delivers measurable value and outcomes. Collaborate closely with software product managers to align platform and adjacent hardware capabilities with offer requirements and value propositions. Coordinate with GTM, Business Development, and Sales teams to define target segments, pricing strategies, value messaging, and enablement materials that position the offers competitively in the market. Work cross-functionally with EPC, technology development, operations, and finance teams to define configurations, commercial terms, and delivery models (e.g., owned, financed, or energy-as-a-service). Lead business case development for new offerings, balancing technology cost structures, revenue models, market incentives, and internal P&Ls. Act as the internal champion and SME for integrated offers, ensuring alignment between technical feasibility, customer value, and business growth objectives. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business, or related field. 6+ years of experience in product management, product marketing, or offer development within the energy management, or software technology sectors. Proven ability to create and commercialize complex, multi-technology offers, ideally combining hardware, software, and financing components. Experience with go-to-market strategy and business model design, including subscription, performance-based, or energy services models. Exceptional communication and storytelling abilities, translating technical complexity into compelling customer and executive narratives. Strong analytical and financial acumen, with ability to build and defend business cases and investment proposals. Travel may be required for up to 15%, depending on business needs. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS MBA or relevant master's preferred. Strong understanding of distributed energy systems, including solar PV, battery storage, and the energy management required to operate these and other systems. Excellent cross-functional leadership skills, capable of influencing without direct authority across engineering, finance, EPC, and business functions. Familiarity with wholesale energy markets, demand response programs, and grid integration concepts, including real-time pricing, carbon signals, and VPP participation. Experience in AI-driven control systems or advanced analytics applications (e.g., predictive maintenance, load optimization, or federated learning). Hanwha Q CELLS America Inc. ("HQCA") is a Qcells company, one of the world's largest manufacturers and providers of solar photovoltaic (PV) products and solutions. Headquartered in Irvine, California, HQCA has been rapidly expanding its business in North America through the expansion of products and solutions, including distributed energy solutions, direct-to-homeowner solar sales and financing, and EPC services. We provide an opportunity to be part of an exciting and growing world-class global business in an interesting and expanding industry of the future. PHYSICAL, MENTAL & ENVIRONMENTAL DEMANDS: To comply with the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 the essential physical, mental and environmental requirements for this job are listed below. These are requirements normally expected to perform regular job duties. Incumbent must be able to successfully perform all of the functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation. Mobility Standing 20% of time Sitting 70% of time Walking 10% of time Strength Pulling up to 10 Pounds Pushing up to 10 Pounds Carrying up to 10 Pounds Lifting up to 10 Pounds Dexterity (F = Frequently, O = Occasionally, N = Never) Typing F Handling F Reaching F Agility (F = Frequently, O = Occasionally, N = Never) Turning F Twisting F Bending O Crouching O Balancing N Climbing N Crawling N Kneeling N The salary range is required by the California Pay Transparency Act and may differ depending on the location of those candidates hired nationwide. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to, skill set, education, licenses and certifications, essential job duties and requirements, and the necessary experience relative to the job's minimum qualifications. This target salary range is for CA positions only and should not be interpreted as an offer of compensation. You may view your privacy rights by reviewing Qcells' Privacy Policy or by contacting our HR team for a copy.

title: Sr. Director, Technical Product Management, Robotics
description: At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com Job Function: Project/Program Management Group Job Sub Function: R&D Project Management Job Category: Professional All Job Posting Locations: Santa Clara, California, United States of America Job Description: Fueled by innovation at the intersection of biology and technology, we're developing the next generation of smarter, less invasive, more personalized treatments. Are you passionate about improving and expanding the possibilities of surgery? Ready to join a team that's reimagining how we heal? Our Surgery team will give you the chance to deliver surgical technologies and solutions to surgeons and healthcare professionals around the world. Your contributions will help effectively treat some of the world's most prevalent conditions such as obesity, cardiovascular disease and cancer. Patients are waiting. We are searching for the best talent for Senior Director, Technical Product Management, Robotics. This role will be based out of Santa Clara, CA. Purpose: The Senior Director of Technical Product Management is a strategic leader responsible for defining and delivering the technical vision for products in the surgical robotics space. Collaborating closely with R&D leaders, engineers, and cross-functional teams, this role ensures the development of innovative technical product roadmaps aligned with business goals and technological feasibility. This leader closely partners with the Program Management Office and Global Strategic Marketing to drive seamless integration of R&D and technical product development efforts throughout the product and program lifecycle. They will spearhead initiatives to establish operational and functional excellence within the technical product management organization, providing regular updates on strategy and execution. Additionally, the Senior Director will represent the R&D function in program, product, and technology roadmap processes, proactively identifying risks, technical challenges, and opportunities for innovation. Leading a team of technical product and program and managers, this role is pivotal in delivering advanced surgical robotics and digital solutions that improve clinical outcomes and drive market leadership. You will be responsible for: Work with Robotics R&D leaders and engineers to build and execute R&D technical product and program roadmaps, ensuring technical feasibility and alignment, as well as efficient execution to business objectives In close partnership with the Program Management Office and Global Strategic Marketing, ensure successful end-to-end integration of R&D roadmaps into the end-to-end, cross-functional product lifecycle. Drive the development and implementation of a functional and operational excellence roadmap for the R&D organization. Provide regular strategic and execution updates within R&D and lead all aspects of their implementation. Represent the R&D organization in Program, Product and Technology Roadmap processes Proactively identify, assess, and mitigate R&D project risks and technical challenges Lead team of technical product and program managers Required Experience and Skills: A minimum of 12+ years of relevant industry experience within product and program management Bachelor's/undergraduate degree in an engineering discipline 5+ years of people management experience Demonstrated success in partnering and influencing across a cross-functional environment Strong ability to drive functional excellence in technical disciplines Strong ability to navigate ambiguity and build clarity through frameworks, roadmaps, and documentation Strong ability to actively develop talent in alignment with Credo-based culture Preferred: Medical device experience with Class II, III in capital equipment development Understanding of Global Regulatory/Clinical requirements of medical technology Other: This role will be based out of Santa Clara, CA. and may require up to 25% travel (International and Domestic) The anticipated base pay range for this role is $238,000 to $382,950 Join our dynamic team and play a key role in redefining surgical care globally! Apply now to make a difference with Johnson & Johnson MedTech. Johnson & Johnson is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by federal, state or local law. We actively seek qualified candidates who are protected veterans and individuals with disabilities as defined under VEVRAA and Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act. Johnson and Johnson is committed to providing an interview process that is inclusive of our applicants' needs. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request an accommodation, please email the Employee Health Support Center (ra-employeehealthsup@its.jnj.com) or contact AskGS to be directed to your accommodation resource. Required Skills: Product Management, Robotics, Technical Program Management Preferred Skills: Agility Jumps, Business Alignment, Continuous Improvement, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Collaboration, Negotiation, Performance Measurement, Process Control, Program Management, Project Management Methodology (PMM), Project Management Office (PMO), Project Reporting, Project Scheduling, Quality Control (QC), Research and Development, Risk Management, Tactical Planning
company_description: Caring for the world, one person at a time... inspires and unites the people of Johnson & Johnson.
